briefTitle: Hemodynamic Effect of Norepinephrine Versus Vasopressin on the Pulmonary Circulation in Cardiac Surgery Patients:
officialTitle: Hemodynamic Effect of Norepinephrine Versus Vasopressin on the Pulmonary Circulation in Cardiac Surgery Patients: a Comparative-effectiveness Quality Project
summary: The relative increase in the mPAP with the same unit increase in MAP adjusted for baseline, and RV function assessed by GLS, between VP and NE in patients with normal and increased pulmonary artery pressure, who require vasopressor support during cardiac surgery.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: during 20 minute period after chest closure
